com.logiccity.minecraft.api

Interface ModCommandInterface

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractBuildCommand, Attack, AutoMine, AutoStaircase, BuildBooleanArray, BuildFloor, BuildLetters, BuildMaze, BuildPlay, BuildPole, BuildWall, CustomModCommandBase, FastMaze, GoBack, GoForward, GoLeft, GoRight, GoToCmd, Small, SmallPrymaid, SmallTriangle, SolveMaze, TallWall, TallWallDiagonal, TallWallSide, Turn

    public interface ModCommandInterface
    The interface for commands that requires continuously running asynchronous operations in update or render tic threads until certain conditions are met

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void cleanupCmd()
      Cleanup the command
      boolean doInCmdInputThread(java.lang.String input)
      Configure this command based on user input from on the chat line.
      boolean doInRenderTicThread()
      Run operations in the render tic thread.
      boolean doInUpdateTicThread()
      Run operations in the update tic thread.
      void initCmd(java.lang.String[] args)
      Initialize the command

    • Method Detail

      • initCmd

        void initCmd(java.lang.String[] args)
        Initialize the command
        Parameters:
        args - command arguments

      • cleanupCmd

        void cleanupCmd()
        Cleanup the command

      • doInUpdateTicThread

        boolean doInUpdateTicThread()
        Run operations in the update tic thread. This method will be invoked every few milliseconds
        Returns:
        true will cause the command to be stopped, false will cause the command to continue

      • doInRenderTicThread

        boolean doInRenderTicThread()
        Run operations in the render tic thread. This method will be invoked every few milliseconds
        Returns:
        true will cause the command to be stopped, false will cause the command to continue

      • doInCmdInputThread

        boolean doInCmdInputThread(java.lang.String input)
        Configure this command based on user input from on the chat line. All command configuration chat inputs start with "/-"
        Parameters:
        input - the string after "/-"
        Returns:
        true will cause the command to be stopped, false will cause the command to continue
